refnamediv.refpurpose: A simple xy line graph widget written using only GTK and cairo.

refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Stable, unless otherwise indicated

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "chart-set-elements" gint : Write "graph-chart-background" gchararray : Write "graph-scale-foreground" gchararray : Write "graph-title-foreground" gchararray : Write "graph-window-background" gchararray : Write "range-scale-major-x" gint : Write "range-scale-major-y" gint : Write "range-scale-minor-x" gint : Write "range-scale-minor-y" gint : Write "range-tick-major-x" gint : Write "range-tick-major-y" gint : Write "range-tick-minor-x" gint : Write "range-tick-minor-y" gint : Write "series-line-width" gint : Read / Write "text-title-main" gchararray : Write "text-title-xaxis" gchararray : Write "text-title-yaxis" gchararray : Write

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A Gtk2/GLib2/cairo GUI application which demonstrates the use of GTK+ and cairo for producing xy line graphs. This widget once created allows you to add one or more data series, then add values to those series for ploting. The X point is assumed based on arrival order. However, the Y value or position is based one the current scale and the y value itself. If the charts x scale maximum is 40, or 40 points, the 41+ value is appended to the 40th position after pos 0 is dropped - effectively rolling the x points from right to left in the chart view.
Packaged as a gtk widget for ease of use and easy inclusion into new or existing programs.

The GlgLinegraph widget has a gobject property for every control option except creating a new data series - glg_line_graph_series_add(), and adding a value to that series - glg_line_graph_series_add_value().

One signal is available 'point-selected' which outputs the Y value most likely under the mouse ptr. For correlation purposes the position of the mouse and the position of the Y point is given in case two or more points are returned.
A 'lgcairo.c' demonstration proram is included to illustrate how to quickly use the widget.

itemizedlist.listitem: Accurate scaling across a wide range of X & Y scales.
Using values ranges above or below 1.
Rolling data points, if number of x points exceed x-scale. (left shift)
Ability to change chart background color, window backgrounds colors, etc.
Popup Tooltip, via mouse-button-1 click to enable/toggle. Tooltip overlays top graph title, when present.
Data points are time stamped with current time when added.
Some key debug messages to console with button-3 enable, then button-2 click/toggle.
Auto Size to current window size; i.e. no-scrolling.

refsect2.title: enum GLGElementID

listitem.simpara: Enables display of the top chart title
Disables display of the top chart title

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new line graph widget

listitem.simpara: a pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_redraw ()
refsect2.para: Updates the current graph showing new changes.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_chart_get_elements ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the current draw setting for the graph. AND it with the desired value to test if what your after is present.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlglineGraph widget
gint containing all current draw flags as defined in GLGElementID

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_chart_set_elements ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether the grids, labels, tooltip, and titles will appear on the chart. All graphs are created with the following defaults; GLG_TOOLTIP | GLG_GRID_LABELS_X | GLG_GRID_LABELS_Y | GLG_TITLE_T | GLG_TITLE_X | GLG_TITLE_Y | GLG_GRID_LINES | GLG_GRID_MINOR_X | GLG_GRID_MAJOR_X | GLG_GRID_MINOR_Y | GLG_GRID_MAJOR_Y

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlglineGraph widget
An or'ed list of GLGElementID indicating what graph elements should be drawn to the screen.

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_chart_set_text ()
refsect2.para:
Copy (without freeing) pch_text into place to be used as the graph title. PangoMarkup is also supported.
GLG_TITLE_X - Bottom x axis title GLG_TITLE_Y - Left vertical y axis title GLG_TITLE_T - Top and considered main title on x axis

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget
GLGElementID of the Title
gchar* string to set in title.
gboolean TRUE if copied, FALSE if copy failed.

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_chart_set_color ()

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget
GLGElementID of the Window Element
gchar* string with name of color.
gboolean TRUE if copied, FALSE if copy failed.

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_chart_set_ranges ()
refsect2.programlisting: void glg_line_graph_chart_set_ranges (GlgLineGraph *graph, gint x_tick_minor, gint x_tick_major, gint x_scale_min, gint x_scale_max, gint y_tick_minor, gint y_tick_major, gint y_scale_min, gint y_scale_max);
refsect2.para: Sets the X and Y ticks and scales for the graph grid area.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget
number of minor divisions for x scale
number of major divisions for x scale
minimum x scale value or starting point
maximum x scale value or ending point
number of minor divisions for y scale
number of major divisions for y scale
minimum y scale value or starting point
maximum y scale value or ending point

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_data_series_add ()
refsect2.para: Allocates space for another data series of y-values and returns the series number of this dataset added which you must keep track of to add values.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlglineGraph widget
The name of the data series
A string containing the line color to be used.
gint The series number of this dataset added ( range 0 thru n )

refsect2.title: glg_line_graph_data_series_add_value ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean glg_line_graph_data_series_add_value (GlgLineGraph *graph, gint i_series_number, gdouble y_value);
refsect2.para: Add a single y value to the requested data series. auto indexes the value if x-scale max is reached (appends to the end) The X value is implied to be the current count of Y-values added.

listitem.simpara: pointer to a GlgLineGraph widget
The data series to add value to.
The value to add. Current range is 0.0 to y-max-scale
gboolean TRUE if value was added, FALSE if add failed.

refsect2.title: The "chart-set-elements" property
refsect2.para: Enable showing these elements of the chart body.

refsect2.title: The "graph-scale-foreground" property
refsect2.para: X and Y chart scale foreground font color.

refsect2.title: The "series-line-width" property
refsect2.para: Width of line drawn for data series.

refsect2.title: The "text-title-main" property
refsect2.para: Title at top of graph on the X axis.

refsect2.title: The "text-title-xaxis" property
refsect2.para: Title at bottom of graph on the X axis.

refsect2.title: The "text-title-yaxis" property
refsect2.para: Title on left of graph on the Y axis.

refsect2.title: The "point-selected" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GlgLineGraph *widget, gdouble x_value, gdouble y_value, gdouble point_y_pos, gdouble mouse_y_pos, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: The ::point-selected signal is emitted after the toggle-on mouse1 click, and sends values closest to the mouse pointer.

listitem.simpara: the line graph widget that received the signal
x value on the chart
y value on the chart
pixel position of y value on chart
pixel position of the mouse ptr on chart
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
